
# The purpose of jsfiddle.js

Welcome!

(This file was written because of bordem)

Now lets get into this.

In your downloads section, you should have:

  

1. jsfiddle.js

2. index2.html

## jsfiddle.js understanding

Please open the jsfiddle.js file. Inside you should see a total of 4 functions. As well as 4 ***function calls***.

At the top of the javascript() function, you should see a vairiable called dusk. You can assign it to the booleans: true or false.

Next, we can see multiple if / else if statements checking what dusk is set to.

Then, under where the dusk variable is made and set, is the constant variable: pen. This variable will activate all of the else if statements. And under all of that, if pen is set to the declared string, it will print a message to the console. At the prompt function inside of the question() function, it will ask the user if they want to start the code. You can see all the else if or if statements.

  

Now, lets move on to the question function. Inside that function, you will find a few if and else if statements, along with a prompt function. The prompt function is used to ask a user a question, (optional) store it in a variable, and declare else if / if statements to determen what answer the user has inputted. If the user has inputted Yes, then it will start the code. If the user has inputted No, then it will not start. Restart is used to restart the command if something is wrong.


## index2.html Understanding
Now, please open index2.html to find the `<head>`, `<body>` and other headings. Now, please locate heading 1 in the `<body>` element. Headings of that type are used to declare titles of a subject. As heading 1, it is currently set to `Hello guys!`. Then, as heading 2, it is currently set to: `This is a work in progress btw` and so on and so fourth. Now, you might be asking, "What are those `<a></a>` elements for?". Those are to provide links to other sites, and / or for download links. Now, to publish this to a website, please use repl.it and copy and paste the code.

# End of understandings
Hope you enjoyed! Under this you will find the notice block. Please read that and thank you once again!
